alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 21 at 5:52PM CDT until March 21 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin San Antonio has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Williamson County in south central Texas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 551 PM CDT, a large and extremely dangerous tornado was located near Sun City, or near Serenada, moving northeast at 30 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. * Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Bartlett, Jarrell, Theon, Schwertner and Walburg. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is developing. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
